The concept was introduced by Edward Tolman in 1948. title: Fuzzy cognitive map
synopsis: A fuzzy cognitive map is a cognitive map within which the relations between the elements (e.g. concepts, events, project resources) of a "mental landscape" can be used to compute the "strength of impact" of these elements. Fuzzy cognitive maps were introduced by Bart Kosko. Ron Axelrod introduced cognitive maps as a formal way of representing social scientific knowledge and modeling decision making in social and political systems, then brought in the computation fuzzy logic - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuzzy_cognitive_map wikipedia]
